result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dayton S Grunewald

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM Defendant Dayton S Grunewald in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer Aty in court for Dayton S Grunewald. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense received an offer from the State. The offer contemplates treatment up front. State would amend to ordinance upon completion of treatment. The Defendant wants to take advantage of the State's offer, and Defense asks for a new date in 60 days. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:38 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Defendant Dayton S Grunewald in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer Aty in court for Dayton S Grunewald. 

Defense is awaiting an offer from the State, but is hopeful case will resolve. Defense believes he has discovery. 
State does not yet have 911 call. 
Court will set a date in 45 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:37 AM Defendant Dayton S Grunewald appeared by Zoom with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 29, 2022.

*Clerk received a letter from Attorney Fischer advising of updated address.

Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward

ADDRESS INFO for Dayton S Grunewald
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 847 Martin St,#305, Waukesha, WI 53186
Initial appearance on July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Dayton S Grunewald in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes Attorney Fischer has attempted to adjourn this matter several times but those requests have all been denied due to victim notification.  No objection by the State to adjourn.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance and allow for the defendant and his attorney to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Request to adjourn court date

Attorney requests to adjourn initial appearance
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 06-29-2022. "Denied. Due to Marsy's law, unless the court receives written notification from Victim's Witness Services that the victim has no objection to the adjournment the date will remain. Counsel may appear via Zoom."
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
